phasing_details.phase_detail: one phase. completed. the application is to extend a temporary planning permission

site_name: Garage Nos. 8-17 And 18-27 Located Under Nos.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents:  007-010, 007-050, 007-100, 007-105, 007-120, 007-121, 007-125, 007-126, 007-130.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | This temporary permission shall be for a limited period of 4 years expiring on 31 August 2028 when the use permitted by this consent shall be discontinued.

Reason: To ensure that the use is temporary in nature in accordance with the permission given. | The application premises shall be used for community facilities including children's internal and external play spaces and toy library (D1 use class) and workshops/studios (B1c use class) and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in use classes D1 or B1c) of the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (or in any provision equivalent to that class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification).
Reason: To protect the amenity and living conditions of neighbouring properties, in

accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4, 7B and 7C, policy 1.1 (g) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
| The materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development hereby approved shall be as set out in the planning application form and the submitted Design & Access Statement.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The B1 and C3 uses shall not commence until all external doors to the premises/kitchen/exercise/multi-function rooms have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows to rooms where noise, smell, smoke or fumes may be emitted, be fixed in an open position.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of nearby dwellings in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Prior to use, gate posts shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators to prevent structural or airborne vibration noise being transmitted to noise sensitive premises and the closing mechanism shall be buffered to adequately silence the operation of the gates. No part of the gates or their supports shall be in direct contact with the external walls or other external parts of adjacent buildings while open or closed.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of nearby dwellings in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2023), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| The use of the garage premises shall not be permitted outside of the hours of 0900 to 1800 Mondays to Sundays.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people at or leaving the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The external area shall not be used (for activities or events) other than between the hours of 8:00 - 18:00 Monday to Friday, 9:00 - 16:00 on Saturdays and at no time on Sunday and Public/Bank Holidays.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people at or leaving the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Continued use of 20 existing garages for a further 4 years period as community facilities involving children's internal and external play spaces and toy library (Use Class D1) and workshops/studios (Use Class E(g)); and retention of associated external alterations.(Part Retrospective)
